## RStudio from bash

I created a program that writes a Rstudio-Project file. Its unclear what of the process I should document where. Some are Linux / Ubuntu tips, points are installation diary items. I did this in a why that I want to (vibe-) code more tools later on.

The program is installed here:

```bash
mkdir -p ~/bin/rproj_create
nvim ~/bin/rproj_create/rproj_create # ← write program

chmod +x ~/bin/rproj_create/rproj_create
```

Now, I added this to `zsh.rc`

```
# Add rproj_create to path
export PATH="$HOME/bin/rproj_create:$PATH"
```


Now I can run:

| Command                                           | Result                         |
| ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------ |
| `create_rproj_file`                               | creates `project.Rproj`        |
| `create_rproj_file "Zürich Projekt"`              | creates `Zürich_Projekt.Rproj` |
| `create_rproj_file "Zürich Projekt" zurich.Rproj` | creates `zurich.Rproj`         |
| `create_rproj_file MyProject --NumSpacesForTab 4` | creates `MyProject.Rproj`      |


The program is tracked here: https://github.com/ratnanil/rproj-create
